We ordered the rabbit with pasta in a white wine sauce with slices of pears. It was truly a lavish meal and the flavors all came together perfectly. I love rabbit so for me it was a treat to find rabbit on the menu. Great selection of red wines with amazing cheeses to go along. The prices are really reasonable for the quality you will be receiving. Our server made us feel like true princesses. He was knowledgeable about everything on the menu. Loved the cold cuts! I shall return and explore more of the menu in the near future. I am a fan of Barbacco and it is a must try if one is visiting the enchanting city of San Francisco.
author: Laura N.

description: One of my favorite go-to restaurants  Amazing food and drinks! So much to chose from and the prices are reasonable. The whole atmosphere inside is very lively and comforting. The staff is very professional and kind.
author: Jessica M.

description: Barbacco is a very  cozy restaurant, mostly I like to go there in the evening. I like how  this place transforms, when the sun goes down. A lot of people of different age have fun there. I like Roasted Hen of the Woods Mushrooms with Parmesan. Everything is so well cooked, that I do not have strength to resist.
author: Anna C.

description: Power lunch.  Power up here.  Spend the money and wear the right jacket.  Great for the unemployed person to impress the informational interviewer.  Food was excellent.  The service was the charm you'd expect.
author: Timothy H.

description:
Made reservations on Monday for dinner at Barbacco. Its located on California and Front St. The space has a modern decor with a long bar that runs the length of the restaurant, however Barbacco only has beer and wine. We ordered the following : 

Roasted Chicories with ham good not great 
Squid served on a bead of fava beans excellent 
Liver Pate' very good served on toasted bead.
Meatballs best dish of the night.
Orecchiette good
Brussels Spouts Ok
Farrotto risotto taste was good but the texture grainy.

Service was good. Parking is easy at night since the financial district is closed. Homeless gantlet is challenging with the concentration of nice restaurants in the area. SF mandate has a tax on all the bills but does nothing to solve the growing homeless / mentally handicapped/  and aggressive panhandlers problem.
author: George F.

description:
Barbacco aka the budget version of Perbacco is a great lunch spot in the FiDi, but the service is not that fast at times so I suggest doing take out if you're not trying to stay long. 

In terms of the food, their bruschetta and cheese plates are DIVINE (3 for $8 and great to share). I always get the pate or hen of the woods (mushroom) bruschetta. If you like a balsamic glaze, you will love any of these bruschettas! The cheese plates with the glazed almonds and "dry" cherries are a great sweet starter. 

In terms of entrees, I usually get the faro or the pacherri. The pacherri has a rich pork Ragu sauce while the faro is very flavorful with the seasoned mushrooms and creaminess of the cheese. The pesto and lasagna are good, but not as filling as these two dishes. 

Overall, Barbacco is a great lunch/dinner spot and the staff is super nice and accommodating, but the food takes a little longer especially in big parties. I highly suggest making a reservation even during lunch!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
LOUD. SO VERY LOUD. 
Other than that, the food was decently good, but not the most exciting I have ever had. The portions were large, and there was more than enough to go around. I had the lamb pasta, but my main memory of this place was having to yell at my friend in order to be heard over the table next to ours. It was just unpleasant in that way. I don't like yelling over my dinner, unless my dinner is a bear that I have caught myself and I am needing to feel manly. This never happens, so I have little reason to want to yell. Ugh.
author: Danielle L.

description: This is right in downtown area so there's no parking until after 6 ... that was a bit hard for all of us but the food was great!!! Must get the meatballs all my friends raves about. I didn't try it because I was just to stuffed from everything we ordered. The squid was amazing n I'm not a squid person very tender n not chewy. Overall everything was pretty good!!! Will definitely go again.
author: Nancy W.

description:
I'm sorely disappointed by my past two visits here. Happy with the first, sad the second, more sad the third.

Tonight? 1.5 stars. Averaging 3 stars from past...

==== the food (+ for good, - for pass) ====
+ Ziti /penne with tomato sauce and cheese: tasty and well cooked pasta

+ Brussels sprouts: a bit oily though still tasty

- free bread: like the other times, not the forte. dry, stale tasting and just not good but the balsamic is very tangy and the olive oil very flavorful 

- Chicken: purely fat and inedible. Texture was off as well. Waiter didn't bother to take it off the bill or anything...or apologize for us not eating it

- roasted squash: too much oil and served with cheese, not for me

- beets: run of the mill, yellow beets

- mushrooms: not particularly flavorful and a very small portion

At ~$40/person, the service was horrendous- i saw another waitress was even fed up with him from the get go.

Note: Didn't see their mushroom risotto tonight

TLDR/ bad service, decent food - go for the pastas
author: Kristie C.

description:
Barbacco is the older sister of the newer adjacent Perbacco.  I had heard that while Perbacco focused more on pasta dishes, Barbacco was a favorite for the more well rounded cuisine, all at a friendly price point, becoming rarer in the city these days. 

We stopped by on a Saturday night and found the place full.  We had an Opentable reservation and were quickly taken to our table. 

It's a long restaurant with bar-like stool sitting and numerous smaller tables along the other side of the restaurant. 

Service was friendly, but they're quite busy and forgot to apply our gift certificate, brought us the wrong bill, and forgot to bring our leftovers but all the minor issues were quickly dealt with.  Our order: 

Crostone - $11. Chicken liver pate spread over toast with cherries.  Amazingly delicious and perfectly heated to be warm over the crunchy toast. 

Polpette - $16.  These Sicilian Meatballs were a touch spicy and a bit denser than I liked but were very flavorful with braised chard and a slightly spicy sugo.  Four large meatballs meant plenty of leftovers. 

Oriechette - $15. This pasta dish of "little ears" was great. Nicely al dente pieces mixed with meaty sausage bites and plenty of pesto.  Another generous serving. 

Brussel Sprouts - $6.  Nice side dish of slightly charred brussel sprouts.  For fans of this vegetable like our table, a hit. 

Overall, Barbacco was a great dinner.  Delicious flavors, generous portions, and hearty Italian fare served in an unpretentious manner with prices that match.  Other than the slight service hiccups, Barbacco is a winner. 

Barbacco accepts credit cards including Amex.
author: Randy F.

description:
9 pm and still crowded! Service was ok but food was bomb. 

The meatballs! Holy meatballs. I've NEVER eaten anything like those. Yummmm! Definitely get at least one order of these between two people - you can thank me later.
author: Roxanne L.

description: Barbacco is my favorite spot in financial district, be it business lunch or dinner with friends. My fiancé and I had our romantic dinner to celebrate our engagement. Whenever I go, I always order Tuscan beef stew which was tender and perfectly cooked with creamy grits. We also ordered cauliflower as side, mussels and baccala. Plenty food for the two of us! We left with content and satisfaction. Btw, service was great too!
author: Carrie Z.

description: So happy our concierge at the Westin St. Francis sent us your way. Great service. Delicious food. Nice ambiance. Definitely will be back.
author: Amy N.

description:
Great spot, interesting preparations, classic flavors. The hostess was a bit snotty but the rest of the service team was friendly and attentive, available but not pushy. 
Our cousin, a twenty year SF local picked out this spot for us to have a casual dinner and it was great!
We started out with the salumi plate and bottle of wine while we chatted and decided on dinner. 
Our orders happened to sample the menu variety:
Soup of the day, Tuscan bread soup and arugula salad - all satisfying and tasted great. The mains: meatballs, mushroom farrotto and the nightly special of squid ink pasta, again all met expectations and we left happy.
author: Susan H.

description:
FOOD: 4 stars
SERVICE: 3.5 stars

I really don't expect much of FIDI restaurants, to be honest. Usually overpriced and just okay. BUT! Not the case here. Very fair pricing and everything I had was pretty good. Very impressed, Barbacco. VERY impressed. 

There's no happy hour here, but the sides and veggies are pretty much HH pricing ($5-6) and again, everything is pretty reasonably priced, so I'd argue that you get better value here.

Appetizer: ROASTED OCTOPUS w/ crushed potatoes -- 3 stars -- roasted octopus was very tender and flavorful! The crushed potatoes were literally just crushed potatoes and not seasoned very much, which understandably would have complemented the more pungent flavor of octopus, but it could have used a dash of salt or butter.

Appetizer: BRUSCHETTA Roasted Squash / Pomegranate /Pumpkin Seed / Peppered Ricotta -- 5 stars -- now, I don't like the idea of paying for bruschetta b/c its literally just toast with stuff on top, but this was AMAZING! It came with 4 big pieces too, not a dinky piece like most other places. Nested on a small slice of soft & chewy Acme bread was.. heaven. It sounded like whatever on the menu but all the components together was simply divine.

MAIN: POLPETTE sicilian meat balls with pine nuts and raisins braised chard / spicy tomato sugo -- 4 stars -- MM! So flavorful and just the perfect amount of cheese on top. The meatballs were a good size as well (like 2 big bites, or a good 4 bites if you like to cut it up a bit). I don't remember seeing any pine nuts or raisins, really, but it was really good.

 FRIED BRUSSELS SPROUTS capers / anchovy / red wine vinaigrette - 4.5 stars - SO GOOD! Savory and just the perfect amount of slight sourness from the vinaigrette. Addictive. Dangerous.

SERVICE was okay. I felt like our server wasn't genuine and just going through the motions, but he did a fair job of making sure we were doing well and catering to whatever we needed.
author: Emily C.

description:
So after reading previous reviews I was excited to try this place. Upon my entry you immediately start sweating because it's sooo hot! The service was fine the waitress was kind. We order the fried Brussels sprouts and they are good. For my meal
I ordered the Rigatoni. It didn't taste fresh at all it reminded me of Thursday dinner on a random week at home. And then there was the tiny bite of chicken. All in all I left the food unfinished.
author: Daisy S.

description:
Good eats and doesn't break the bank - we came in a large group and were able to sample a variety of things which is always nice.

Sides and appetizers were solid - as was the squid yum.  The pastas are really good - they did well mixing the flavors and the pasta was fresh.  Only con was there didn't seem to be enough pure vegetarian options though I'm sure if we had looked more carefully we could have asked for them to make them more vegetarian.  

Great ambiance too, love the high tables!
author: Kay C.

description:
Riesling - dry but not bad...

Halibut was the special and it was really good with the mushrooms..was sorta small..4.5/5

Brussels sprouts were a bit burnt and came late, wasn't the best 2.5/5

The meatball was really good, sauce was amazing, came in 3 pieces, 5/5

Cheese and prosciutto was not bad, arugula was a nice touch to the fried wonton strips 3/5

Lamb pasta was really flavorful, does have an after taste..4/



Service was so so, I mean I got my water poured but the server was not friendly, didn't smile much, etc

My friends got steak and it was super raw, you can see the tendon..

 Gelato is like store bought, nothing special..dark chocolate and vanilla bean is so so.. 1/5..
author: Minerva L.

description:
I came here with a couple of my clients for lunch (today was my second visit). Booked a reservation through OpenTable for 11:30 and was seated promptly. 

Service: 5/5
+ Nothing to complain about here. Polite servers and waitresses, quick service.

Food: 4/5
- Orrechiette: 3/5 not a fan. Too greasy! I wasn't impressed with the flavor either, or maybe the oil just got in the way.
- Squash & kale salad: 5/5 so fresh! Just the right amount of dressing, and I love roasted squash on salads and sandwiches. Pomegranate seeds make it pretty and add a pop of sweetness!
- Prosciutto, pear, balsamic bruschette: crunchy bread and the toppings were well paired. I could've easily eaten three of these!
- My clients ordered the lasagna and vegetable soup: they liked both a lot!

I'd come back!
author: Melanie W.

description:
Here for dinner on a Thursday evening. Been here a few times before and it wasn't at the level of service and quality as before.

Booked 7:30p dinner reservations and waited till 8p to be sat. I understand the party at the table we were to be sat at took awhile to leave. Maybe it's good to have extra buffer time for delayed seating, or let the diners ahead of us know there's another party being sat at a certain time.

Had corn fusilli - was OK. Would not order again.

I'm hesitant to bring out of guests here next time.
author: Mary H.

description: Came in here for a quick business lunch for 2 and sat at the bar. **Please, please, please** update the menu for the butcher salad to say that it comes with red onions and olives - both of which I would asked to have removed. I tried to pick out both but it was impossible, especially when trying to look professional at my meeting. This was a quick lunch, so no time to ask for another salad without those ingredients or another dish. So now I'm left with red onion breath for the rest of my afternoon meetings...
author: Jeanette Q.

description:
We made a late night reservation at around 9pm on a Saturday. The place wasn't too crowded around that time so a reservation wasn't necessary, but the restaurant itself is pretty small so during peak hours, a reservation is highly recommended.

For 2, we got 2 different types of pasta and a glass of red wine each (recommended by the waiter) and the pasta was absolutely delicious and the wine was delightful as well. If you don't know what wine to order, I would recommend asking the waiter as they give their best recommendations based on what dish you order.

The pasta was so delicious, but the reason I cannot give 5 stars is because of the portion size. The pastas we ordered, which are the main entrees, were SO SO SO small in their portions; it was almost shocking. I have a very small stomach so I never finish my food, ever, but the pasta portion was SO small, I finished it in about 10 minutes. I know what a regular Italian food portion size looks like and this place is definitely below average. It felt as if I ordered a kids meal. We paid $80 total including tax and tip (including the wine too), but we were not full at ALL. We ended up going to a different restaurant a few hours after because the meal here did not fill us up at ALL.

Although the service, ambience, food quality, and the taste were all 5 stars, I really have to take off 2 stars for the smallest Italian food portion size I've seen and for paying $20 for a pasta and not getting full from it.

Overall, a great restaurant, but kids meal portion sizes :(
author: Jen S.

description:
It's our last night in SFO, so we planned to find a place downtown, try to get something special before heading out to the airport.

Yelp guided us to Barbacco Eno, a small Italian place with a long bar on one side and tables on the other. Note: parking on the street was easy, most restrictions are lifted during the weekend.

As an appetizer I ordered the Nduja (spicy, smoked Calabrian soft salame) with french (?) bread, it was excellent.

The we ordered the Lumache (red wine pasta shells / pork ragu / parmigiano) and the Special
of the night (it was a delicious fish, but I can't remember it's name!!! Dam!)

In summary: food was 5 stars, service was a bit lacking, our waiter was frequently missing and inattentive, I had the impression he didn't care much about tourists (he forgets that we have Yelp on our side), so 3 stars here, and wine selection is good but on the expensive side (a glass of a average white wine ran a $12 price tag), so a 4 star is fitting.

Anyway, we enjoyed the place and the food, recommended!
author: Alexandre H.

description:
Great ambiance for after work drinks and food with friends, or a romantic date night. It's a good location right in the heart of the financial district.

We did not get any drinks, but the food was good. I got the corn fusili with pesto. Not the best pesto pasta i've ever had but it had a lot of texture and was a huge portion. I probably wouldn't get it again, but I would like to try the lasagna. We also tried the fried brussel sprouts which were BOMB. I love brussel sprouts.

The acme bread that they brought it was very meh. Nothing special, and it wasn't even warm. My friend got the mushroom risotto which was flavorful, but pretty heavy.

Overall: Would come here again, but would order a different pasta.


I came here a second time and started with a bottle of the pinot noir which was really really good. I would definitely get it again. Then my friend and I split this salad with burrata, prosciutto and arugula. It was incredible. Soooo good and I love burrata. Then we split two pasta dishes- the lasagna and the orchiette. Neither of them blew my mind, to be honest. The lasagna was better, pretty chessey but heavy on the béchamel. The orchiette was so plain and nothing special at all. 

Overall: I would not get a pasta next time I came here. I would get some appetizers and maybe a meat or seafood dish.
author: Jenna G.

description:
Our service was great, the food was great. I don't remember the last time I walked out of a restaurant so happy with my meal. As I mentioned in the tips: Get the Brussels sprouts! I didn't know you could love a meal so much.
It was one of the best things I've tasted in a long time. You won't regret it. Even if you are not a Brussels sprout lover.
author: Mila C.

description:
Dinner review. 

Crostone (chicken liver pate, cherries, saba) - 3/5
Chicories (pancetta, soft egg, pangratatto) - 2/5
Polpette (meatballs) - 2/5 - 7x7
Agnello (Lamb shank) - 2/5
Brussel sprouts (capers, anchovy) - 3/5

Overall, "I've experienced better."
author: Mark O.

description:
I made a reservation at 1 15 pm on a Thursday.  We got there on time and we were shown to two bar seats-- um NO.  If you accept a reservation -I expect a table.  There was a table we saw for 2 that was open and the hostess literally told me those were "saved".  "Saved"?  Is my reservation not as important as someone else's?
Hostess told me "everyone has reservations"--clearly someone needs to figure out what a reservation IS.  You stop taking reservations when you KNOW you won't have tables.  Since I am like the 10th person complaining about this very thing-- shame on you-- horrible business practice.

I went to your restaurant next door and absolutely loved it.  I will never go back to this place-- and since I work right there -- and I recommend restaurants all the time to folks-- this experience, especially when I see the other complaints about it-- Show stupidity or greed.
author: Dana H.

description: FYI they do NOT have happy hour. When I searched on Yelp 'Happy Hour Specials' near the ferry building this came up as one of the top results. Called to see if they did have HH because info online was confusing.
author: Kristin L.

description: Co-worker and I were gonna go to Ramen Bar but there was a long line so I suggested this place. Been here numerous times and the food is always good. Love the Shrimp & Squid sammie!!! YUM :P
author: Linda W.

description:
Italian food is one of my favorites (good ole pasta never lets me down) and Barbacco does a pretty good job here. All the pasta portions were very large so the prices aren't too outrageous (we had leftovers). I went with 3 other friends and we ordered the following:
-Seared local squid: good especially with the cannellini beans that come with it but not a necessity and could be passed if you want dessert instead.
-Ziti Al Forno: very chewy fresh tomato based pasta, I enjoyed this a lot! This is a vegetarian option btw.
-Orecchiette: creamy pesto like pasta, tasty! 
-Corn Fusilli: delicious and gluten free (who says you can't have good pasta without gluten!). The prosciutto meat was super good. It's definitely another creamy type of pasta but it's soo good! Highly recommend this one.
-Steak (can't remember the exact name and not on the menu online): this was good but we asked for it medium rare and it came out well-done so we had to ask about it but they immediately took it away and gave us a new one cooked correctly so won't penalize them there. 

Overall I had a good experience here and would recommend it if you're in the area!
author: Tammy Y.

description: Sat at the bar and the service was great. Nice recommendations on local brews and food. Was busy and loud, but it fit the character of the place. Enjoyed it and would go back!
author: Robert P.

description:
Came here with a reservation on a Saturday night.  Valet parked for $10 plus tip.  Hostess told that for a party of two, you have to sit at the counter facing the food prep counter, or wait 20 minutes for an open table.  We chose to sit at the counter mainly because we don't mind checking out the chefs doing their thing, and because the tables are so close together, you have zero privacy.  But what good is a reservation anyway?

Went for the arugula salad with fresh fruit and  broiled octopus as starters.  Both were very tasty.  For entrées, we went for the orrechetti with fennel sausage, and the rigatoni with pork and beef ragu.  Both were excellent.  Thought the polenta cake with gelato and fruit dessert was OK.  

Service was excellent.  Cheaper than Perbacco.
author: Doctor G.

description:
What's wrong with this restaurant reservation policy? I made a reservation and we I arrived the hostess took me to the bar. I made a reservation to get a table, if I wanted to sit at the bar I would not have made a reservation. 

Besides that, the updated menu lacks creativity. Most of the good stuff is gone (Lasagna, Bucatini all'Amatriciana, Canneroni and a few other ones I can't recall) and the dishes left are either the ones that I have had a million times or newest ones that aren't even good.

I also found two positive things to say about Barbacco. The restaurant still offers free sparkling water and the rude and short bartender with red hair does not seem to be working there any longer. These are good news for the guests who had to deal with her attitude day after day.
author: Laurie C.

description:
We had a great dinner and the hotel Omni got us in
Reasonable price and good service
Enjoyed the experience and recommend
author: Robert H.

description: Corbonara was butter heavy, pancetta light. Everything else was good. Brussel sprouts and Bolognese we're highlights.
author: Brett F.

description:
This is in the old Aqua location and it continues in the same quality vein of Aqua. It's also the poor sister of Perbacco but still has high quality food and service.

We started with the crostini topped with chicken liver pate. It was excellent

DH had the orecchiette and it was wonderful.  We shared the Brussels sprouts which are exceptional--a guest at the adjacent table said they are cooked in duck fat.  I had the lamb shank--the weakest dish of the evening.  We were rushing off to am oboe so did not have time for dessert.

We will definitely return although we were by far the oldest guests there.
author: Joanna S.

description: Service was excellent, food was okay.  I appreciate that they moved us to a table after originally seating us at the counter. I preferred my husband's polpette (meatball) dish to the fresh fish I ordered.  Fish was good but wasn't fully cooked.  I'm okay with fish being undercooked a little, but it was about half way cooked -- didn't have time to return it because we were going to a movie.
author: Kyoko Y.

description:
TLDR: Get the meatballs / seasonal chicken. Feeling healthy? Brussel Sprouts.

My company orders from Barbacco waaaaay too many times so I can say for certain which are my favorites. Sicilian Meatballs!!! They are gigantic (small fist size) and they taste really good. The sauces are definitely infused in this juicy meatball. Soooo good, can't get enough. My other favorite is the Seasonal Chicken. It's always cooked perfectly because the meat just slides right off the bone. I also heard great things about the brussel sprouts but I'm not a brussel sprouts kind of person so none for me.
author: Benita M.

description: The octopus and cheese were absolutely amazing. This restaurant does appetizers and wine right. The sides (cauliflower and brussel sprouts) were excellent as well. The pasta dishes were larger portions than they should have been and were fairly bland compared to the other dishes. I'd recommend this restaurant as a quick stop as opposed to a full meal.
author: Lyndy W.

description:
OY! Lunch is abysmal. 3 stars for the average food. 2 stars for slow service.

I ordered the orecchiette pasta with fennel sausage and broccoli rabe. It was decent, though not memorable. The broccoli rabe was cut up into small chunks and was a bit mushy. Bleh!

I also ordered the radicchio salad, which never arrived so I can't give you a review on it.

If you want to be in and out of lunch in one hour, barbacco can do it. But if you're looking for something more than temporary relief from hunger via average food, this is not the place for you!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Once my friend found me at next door Perbacco, Barbacco's more expensive and confusingly similarly named sister restaurant and retrieved me (whoops), we were seated at the bar at Barbacco and had a filling meat-centric meal.
  
We shared the codfish fritter appetizer and meatball and chicken entrees. The standout for me were definitely the meatballs, which included the interesting addition of green raisins. The plate included three huge meatballs too, more than enough to fill even two people and way more food than I was expecting for a fancier restaurant--fancier than I'm used to, anyways. While everything was good, I probably wouldn't get the codfish fritters again as they were pretty mushy inside. The chicken tasted tender but chicken just inherently can't compete with red meat flavor-wise in my opinion. The bill was not more than $30 per person, perfectly reasonable for the high quality of the food. I would definitely recommend Barbacco as a classy place for flavorful Italian fare in the city.
author: Amy G.

description: Sublime. Three of us shared our meals. Orecchiette, bolognese and sea bass. Pear salad and a cheese. All spectacular. We did not have reservations, but they were kind enough to seat us as long as we could be out within about 90 minutes. I might've preferred a full two hours but the service was great and we have zero complaints. It was one of the best Italian meals I've ever had.
author: Tim B.

description:
When I called in to make a reservation for 2 at noon, I was put on hold for 5 minutes because they said they are busy at the moment.  I decided to hang up because it was taking unnecessary time to make a reservation and try the call later when they are not as "busy."  When they finally put my name down and my fellow dining partner went in before me, there was no one greeting at the entrance.  This service experience is just horrible as a first timer checking out this restaurant. 

Wine selections are nice and this is a decent spot to dine at, but it just doesn't make up for the lack of service.  There's plenty of restaurants to go around in the FiDi.

We ordered up their bruschetta with the 3 choice toppings of Broccoli rabe, Tuscan chicken liver pate and Caponata.  I liked the chicken liver pate the most because it was savory. The Caponata with chopped eggplants in vinaigrette was a nice touch as well.  Their bread was very crunchy. 

I ordered up the Paccheri, lamb ragu.  The pasta was a bit undercooked, the lamb shoulder was nicely braised and a homely entrée, nonetheless.  As for the Peposo, the beef needed more tenderizing and polenta needed more texture.  Our waitress didn't seem too enthused on waiting.  

The service here is just uncalled for.  The whole time I was thinking that I should have dined somewhere else - treated us with better service, per say and welcomes our business.  Luckily, a different hostess thanked us when we were ready to head out the doors. That saved a star rating.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
This is place where you end up paying more for the experience than the food.

I love the ambiance -- the mood, lighting, decor, and layout are solid 5 stars. I came here for dinner and think it's a nice place for a date! 

Food: Underwhelming. I ordered the braised chicken thighs, and it was actually a little cold and had excess fat that should have been removed since it didn't add to the flavor. There was too much parsley that masked the soft tomato and pepper notes.
author: Julia Y.

description:
What a delightful find!  One of my friends is vegan and out waiter was helpful in ensuring that she had an excellent meal that included brussel sprouts, beers and a side dish of eggplant. 

My husband had the chicken and I had the tagliata. Both dishes were very good. Had the alfogoto for desert.  

Will definitely return!
author: Brenda L.

description: We got to the restaurant just before they stopped serving food at 9 PM.  My friend got the Brussels sprouts and a pasta dish and both were good.  I however got a lamb shank entree and a risotto type appetizer that were cold and almost inedible.  Service overall was efficient and friendly, just be very careful what you order.
author: David C.

description:
Great Italian restaurant in financial district that's not too pricey. They had a dinner reservation available for a table for 4 on the same day I called. Service was extremely attentive and nice.

We got the brandacujun ($11) which were salt cod fritters and gnocco fritto ($14) which had amazing burrata cheese for appetizers. I got the lasagna bolognese ($15) for my main entree. It was very creamy and tasty although a little too heavy for me to finish alone. I really enjoyed the orecchiette ($15) that my friend ordered. The fennel sausage was delicious with the cheese and slightly spicy sauce. I would get that next time.

For dessert I got the lemon-thyme panna cotta ($6). I loved it! Not too sweet but very flavorful. My favorite dessert was the butterscotch ice cream affogato ($5). It was one of the best I've ever had!
author: Linda X.

description: bring your wallet!! The service is good and food is to die for. Order the brussel sprouts and gelato for dessert. I thought the corn gelato would taste odd but it's honestly one of the best ice creams i've had.
author: Gaby G.

description: Good food but not really great. The burrata was very good, but I was a bit underwhelmed with the orechiette (broccoli and fennel sausage) pasta. I'd suggest steering towards entrees like the chicken, fish, lamb chops, etc. if I went back again. This place does not have a liquor license, so look elsewhere if you want cocktails.
author: Travis V.

description: The vibe is really good and is in financial district so it's very convenient for people who work there. Definitely try their braised beef because it is so tender and the taste is phenomenal! My friend made a reservation and so we didn't wait at all. Overall we had an enjoyable experience there!
author: Sophie L.

description:
Great Italian food at relatively decent prices (as far as SF goes) in a pretty convenient location in Financial District.

Try the brussel sprouts! They're just the right amount of crispy and soft, nicely flavored with oil, salt, and a bit of a sour / tangy kick.

As for the main dishes, I've been here a few times and enjoyed everything I've ordered, including the risotto, ragu, and meatballs. The cheese flavoring on their pastas is kind of intense, which is delicious up until the last few bites, when it becomes overwhelming. Still, generally a pretty decent Italian meal in an easily accessible location.

Note: you need to ask for bread, but it is free! And it's Acme bread, so it's awesome.

The place gets very crowded and is somewhat noisy (it seems like a Financial District favorite) so try to make a reservation, and don't count on sitting at a table if there's only a few of you. Every time I've been here, even with a reservation, we've been seated at the bar. It's still great, but a bit less space and you're not facing each other.

Good for a quick catch-up meal with friends who work nearby, especially if you're looking for some Italian but don't want to climb the hill to North Beach!
author: Brittany C.

description:
The food was very good but small portions, be prepared to purchase more than one plate.  The service was pretty good even though it was busy.  I did have my wine decanted which was great but we had to pour our own wine.  Not the end of the world but it was odd. 

They guy sitting next to us took his shoes and socks off, pretty disgusting, no one asked him to put them back on.  No shoes, no shirt, no service needed to be invoked.
author: Steve S.

description:
A busy lunch spot in the heart of financial district. Since I came here by myself, I didn't have to wait; however, definitely make a reservation if you are coming with a group of coworkers. 
For starters, I had bruschetta with chicken liver, coppa, and crushed peas. However, what I love the most from Barbacco is their beef stew! It was tender, juicy and flavorful which I enjoyed greatly! For dessert, I had the panna cotta. Although it was a bit too sweet for my taste, it was well-made and decorated. Since it's a block away from my work, I will come back again for its beef stew :)
author: Jennifer F.

description:
A little cute restaurant in Fidi next to Tadich Grill and Perbacco! I love the decor and atmosphere. The chairs were comfy but getting onto the seats was a bit awkward. We kept bumping in the tables next to us so it is a bit cramped in the restaurant. 

(/)Bruschetta - burrata cheese / arugula / prosciutto. The burrata cheese was way too gooey and soft for my taste. I live burrata cheese that are more "stringy" and chewy. It was a good dish to try but I think I'll skip it and try something else next time as a appetizer. 

(+) lasagna bolognese - spinach pasta / ragu bolognese/ besciamella sauce . I personally loved the lasagna. After seeing so many pictures and positive reviews about this dish, I decided to go with it. The serving seemed a bit small at first but it was actually pretty filling. Perfect sauce and the spinach lasagna was a nice touch. It wasn't too heavy as a I expected. 

(+) orecchiette - "little ears" / cavolo nero/ fennel sausage / pecorino cheese. I actually really enjoyed this dish too. I only tried a little of it from my friend but I'll definitely be getting this one if I come back here. I loved the fennel sausage on top. It was salty and added a nice flavor to the overall creamy dish. 

(-) rigatoni alla carbonara -pasta tubes/ guanciale pecorino romano / egg / black pepper. I'm usually not that picky of a eater when it comes to pasta but I didn't enjoy this dish at all. The pasta tubes itself had a rubbery/plastic taste to it. I couldn't get myself to eat more than 2-3 tubes. Meh. Do not recommend. 

(+/) chocolate nemesis cake - strawberries/ fudge/ toffee crumble/ vanilla crema. I seriously don't know how I would able to finish this dessert plate by myself. We shared this between 4 people and we were so full! The chocolate cake tastes like the inside of a truffle. Super rich and creamy but it is also really heavy. I love the toffee crumble on top. The vanilla crema is also really light to balance out how heavy the chocolate is. 

Overall, pretty decent experience. We were a bit disappointed that the drinks menu were only wine and didn't have any cocktails but it makes sense. The staff were pretty quick. I do recommend making a reservation ahead of time. We came around 5:30 and the whole restaurant was full by 6pm!
author: Tram N.

description:
Two words come to mind when recalling the dining experience here: decent and average. Regrettably, I can't use those adjectives to describe my dining companion.  
They have non alcoholic local ginger beer here which is fine. It's not as good as Maine Root Ginger brew. The buratta salad consisted of two slightly burnt pieces of bread topped with buratta and five pieces of arugula. Thanks for helping with my diet plan. The olive side had mostly really small olives drenched in oil. 
Your life will not suffer if you don't spend time here. Regrettably, I can also say that about my dining companion.
author: Zak R.

description: I was so pleased with the ambiance in Barbacco, and our server was incredibly warm and knowledgeable.  I went for lunch with a coworker, we ordered TONS of food - meatballs, 2 different bruscettas, lasagna, fusilli and two different desserts.  All selections were very tasty, not too heavy and very easy to share.  I am looking forward to returning soon!
author: Jessika S.

description:
We had reservations for four at 6:00 pm. We were seated (or attempted to be seated) at a table near the front of the restaurant. The tables were positioned in such a way that there were, literally, only inches between the tables. To get seated along the wall, we had to move the tables that were to either side (and no one was seated there yet) so that we could squeeze in to the seats along the wall. Of course, once someone sat to either side, it would have been impossible to exit the table from those seats without having the people at the adjoining table get up to move their table.

Bottom line: packing people in like sardines does not make for a pleasant dining experience. Very disappointing for a restaurant with as good as a reputation as Barbacco. Fortunately we were able to get seated at Perbacco, at a table that actually allowed for some breathing room, so the night was not a complete disappointment.
author: Anne W.

description: Definitely a cool spot- large mirrored walls,seating available at tables or at the bar. I was visiting with one of my friends and we sat at the bar, service was quick and great. The food was alright, I ordered the linguini and she got the bolognese. Both were a bit too salty, and the linguini tasted more like chicken noodle soup. The prices were standard for a dinner place in SF from what I understand.  nothing super exciting but not bad!
author: Erina T.

description: Superb meal and great wine. Had the chicken under a brick and sampled many of the other dishes. Everyone was happy with their meal.
author: Evan S.

description: Not bad for the price. The only thing is it is too crowded and too loud. Have to talk really loud to make others hear you.
author: Kelvin Y.

description:
Came here for lunch on a weekday and it was packed with corporate types.  So if you want to have a power lunch, make a reservation!

The food was all pretty delicious and the service was good, although slow. 

Here's what I tried:

Toasted Almonds - Toasty!

Fried Brussel Sprouts - Seriously these were the best Brussel Sprouts I've ever had.  I love Brussel Sprouts and am usually pretty picky about them, and these guys just blew it out of the water.

Paccheri (large pasta tubes with pork ragu) - Great dish.  A little on the small side, which is actually good because you don't want to enter a food coma right after lunch.  My only complaint is that the pork ragu had way too much fat for my taste.  But, to each their own.  

Too expensive for a regular lunch spot, but great for special occasions or when on the company's dime.
author: Denis S.

description: Constantly rotating menu, but everything that I have had from here is delicious and filling so the short menu doesn't bother me. Just don't get too attached to a dish because it might not be there. I'm bad about making reservations, so I'm always sitting at the weird bar type areas for my meals instead of a table.
author: Jessie N.

description: Because of Serena, I am giving this place a five star. Super good appetizers and good drinks. Definitely coming back.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
I got a gluten-free pasta dish that was AMAZING. It was so refreshing to go to an Italian restaurant that has gluten-free pasta options. And our waiter was this guy with a mullet who was very attentive and accommodating. Nice guy.

Also, it's a clean restaurant with gorgeous sleek interior.
author: Allison D.

description: We came here for a quick snack and a drink. We walked in and were seated right away. Service was great. Environment is immaculately clean. The presentation of the food was absolutely beautiful. My husband ordered the octopus and my friend and I ordered the cheese plate. Everything was delicious! The drinks were awesome too.
author: Lauren H.

description:
Great place for lunch in the financial district close to Embarcadero station.  My friend swore by this place because of two of their dishes, the meatballs and the chicken thighs.  I finally got to check it out a few weeks ago.  It's a bustling place at lunch.  They won't seat you until your party's there which I thought was fair considering how busy they are.

We ordered four bruschetta at $3/each (you can also get 3/$8):  asparagus, mushroom, chicken pate, and anchovy.  They were all excellent, and I specially liked the pate.  

We both ordered the polpette (meatballs, $16) which came in three gigantic pieces.  I was only able to eat two of them and had to take one home.  I think for lunch, this was way too much food and I would have been happy with two for less price.  From the reviews, and my friend's recommendation, I was really expecting a lot from the polpette.  While I thought they were good, (and even the cold leftover did well the next day), it didn't change my life or anything.  But then, can a meatball really do that to anyone?

For dessert, we had a scoop each of coffee and butter-scotch gelato.  Definitely get these.  They were close to perfection one can find in gelato.  The coffee stracciatella surpasses the butter-scotch, IMO, but we were happy to have gotten both.

Overall a delicious lunch for a bargain at $60 for two people.  I will definitely be back!
author: Amihan M.

description:
I wanted to try more things on their menu! I think this restaurant is more like a $$$ then $$ since the portion size is quite small. If you want a filling meal you'll end up ordering quite a bit. 

It has dim lighting and a comprehensive wine list so a good date spot. Definitely saw quite a few tables that were on dates. As I mentioned the portion for each dish is pretty small so I would recommend sharing. My favorite dishes were the meatballs and the bucatini  all'amatriciana. The arugula and radicchio salad was also a nice started to get to open up your appetite. We also got the carrots and cauliflower as sides and both were amazing. 

Highly recommend this place and I'll be back to try more dishes!
author: Rohenne L.

description: Such a nice service! Love, Love, Love!!!! Host was very personable, greeted me & my sisters with such joy. The lighting was dark though and can feel un welcoming at first but their customer service makes up for it!
author: Michaela J.

description:
Another sad case of a great restaurant losing its shine. 8 years ago I raved and raved, and most of what was good about that night is gone. 

Not only was the food mostly bland and indifferently prepared, but even the table arrangements have gotten worse. They used to have tables aligned perpendicular to the wall, some 2 and 4 tops and some communal. Now they have just one row of tables against the wall, with a bench on the wall side that is a distinctly different height than the chairs that face it. So you will not be able to look directly at your tablemates, they will be either looking up or looking down at you. And once you sit down, don't expect to get up. The tables are so close together, that it took four people at two tables to try to open up even a small space for my wife to be able to go the restroom. And the servers can barely get in to change plates without much bumping. If they'd taken just ONE table out, it would make everybody more comfortable, but I guess they're hurting for the dollars now, so no chance of that.

Why are they hurting for the dollars? (and what once was a tough reservation is now a walk-in-anytime place, the demand is gone). Because the food is just not great anymore. When you had one of the best brussels sprout dishes in the city (made with duck fat) why would you ever change it? But they have, to a version that is over-vinegared and just OK. 

And the menu used to be fun, with variations of bruschetta as appetizers, and so many great small plates. Now it is just like any other Italian restaurant in the city, except with mediocre food.

We had a pasta with bolognese that was barely better than a canned product. Broccolini side dish was totally bland. It's one thing when the ingredients you add to a dish don't prove flavorful, but they somehow managed to make even the vegetable itself flavorless.

The meatballs that always used to be great were still very good. And the octopus was perfectly cooked, though the other ingredients in the dish were again flavorless. How can they do that so often?

I'm sure this is a new chef, with his or her own menu. Just not one I like anymore.

One thing that shone was the service. We had someone in our party with some dietary restrictions, and the waiter was incredibly helpful, checking repeatedly with the chef and helping us find options. The only thing i felt OK about while paying the bill was the tip.
author: Michael M.

description:
Had an amazing dinner here a couple months ago and just now getting around to writing the review. Barbacco is the sister restaraunt (and slightly less expensive version) of Perbacco right next door, but it definitely doesn't lack in quality or taste!

We arrived a little early for our reservation, and decided to hop on over to Perbacco for a drink while we waited. They don't sell any hard alcohol here, and wanted to start off with a few cocktails. Once our table was ready we just popped on over next door, which is super convenient!

We ordered a few things to share around the table, which included the following:

-Fried Polenta bites: I'm used to having polenta in its creamy form, but these were so tasty and flavorful! Definitely a good app to start off the meal!
-Bruschetta with prosciutto, burrata, and arugula: so tasty! The burrata is fresh and the prosciutto and arugula really topped everything off well.
-Orecchiette: pesto was amazing and the fennel sausage was a lovely touch.
-Lasagna Bolognese: loved this one! The spinach pasta noodles were some of the best I've tasted, and the ragu bolognese was delicious.
-Polpette: REALLY amazing meatballs and may be some of the best I've had. These are a must try for sure.

Overall I loved Barbacco! It's definitely worthy of the 5 star rating, and I can't wait to try Perbacco next!
author: Jaymie S.

description:
It's strange when the girl you're seeing has a son that's almost your age. 

My friend finds this funny as we walk in to Barbacco without a reservation. Why neither of us thought to call ahead since we work so close by shows you how neither of us think things through.

I tell my buddy that I haven't met Miss Yoga's son yet, but honestly, I really don't want to since he's suppose to be wild and crazy and that's coming from her, not me.

I picture Robin Arryn from Game of Thrones since she said her own son hit her. Tell you something, if that were my boy, he wouldn't dare strike a woman, let alone his own mother, lest he get a beat down. Or be thrown from the moon door, depending on my temperament. 

The lasagna here was served on the cold side, which is why I can't give this place 5 stars, but it was tasty. The liver toast was excellent, and the brussell sprouts were some of the best I've had in awhile.

Finishing the meal off with coffee ice cream was the perfect dessert.
author: Jack R.

description: We were seated promptly, and the service was good too as we were seated at the bar. The portions are of a decent size, but the food was not too impressive. I had the risotto which was soupy and the rice seemed grainy after biting into it which made it feel like it wasn't cooked slowly in the traditional fashion. My friend had the bolognese and said it was just a decent pass dish. Food-wise I wouldn't expect anything special here.
author: Bob S.

description: Love this spot! I come here for work lunches and every time it is great! They have wonderful appetizers - brussels sprouts are great! The meatball is one of my favorite things to get. My only complaint about this place is that they aren't able to accommodate large parties very easily.
author: Makenzi B.

description: We had the ears pasta with broccolini sauce, meatballs, and brussels sprouts. The pasta was good, the meatballs were great, and I personally didn't care much for the brussels sprouts but I don't really like heavily fried foods. Overall, the restaurant was pleasant and the food was pretty good.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
I went here for a late dinner on a Wednesday night with my sister, who was in SF for business for just a quick trip. I was able to make a reservation easily, which was great. We were seated right away, we got a seat at the bar rather than a table. The seating seems a bit squished to me - there was very little room between tables so it might not be  a good spot for an intimate date. The food was pretty good; I got the mussels which were on the starteres menu but enough for a meal. Came with dipping bread which was delicious! My sister got the mushroom risotto which I had a bite of and it was delicious - big chunks of mushroom and a nice creamy sauce.

The wine list is very varied but (as with all SF restaurants) quite pricey by the glass. The service is very quick and the atmosphere is intimate (though, like I said, not very well laid out). I'd recommend it for a date but not a business dinner. Pretty upscale and the only real restaurant within a few blocks.
author: Becky M.

description:
I love so many things about this place! 

First - the brussel sprouts. They used to fry it in duck fat, but I checked the menu just now and duck fat isn't listed on there anymore. I'm not sure how it taste without the duck fat, but with it, it's delicious. It's not greasy at all, and very well seasoned.

I like the paccheri with pork ragu. The pasta is so fun to eat and the pork ragu is very tender. 
I also like to get the corn fusilli with pancetta (but replace the fusilli with paccheri). That dish with the paccheri pasta is very creamy, and there are lots of sauce to go with your pasta. My friend orderdd it as is from the menu (with the fusilli pasta) and she thought it was kind of dry. My coworkers love the lasagana but I've never tried it. 

The bruschette with chicken liver pate is good too. 

The only thing I don't like is the orecchiette with fennel sausage - this dish was too salty for me.   

Writing this review makes me want to order from here for dinner tonight!
author: Michelle T.

description:
I came for a small work lunch on a weekday in a group of 3. We had reservations, but we still had to wait a while - maybe 15 min - before our table was ready.

Overall, great food! We shared the FRIED BRUSSELS SPROUTS and the BAKED CAULIFLOWER, as well as an order of MEATBALLS (comes with 3) as appetizers. 

The brussels sprouts were fantastic. The capers and anchovies weren't overwhelming, but gave the veggies this amazing meaty and complex flavor. I don't think I've had vegetables quite like that before; I kept going back for more.

The meatballs were really good as well; a little on the sweet side (from the raisins, I guess). The cauliflower was also good, but not as good as the other two. 

For my main dish, I had the CORN FUSILLI, which was really, really delicious. The corn kernels added a bright pop of sweetness and texture that added a fresh contrast with the rich pasta sauce and pancetta. Great dish!
author: Liz F.

description:
The space was longer than wide and crowed with patrons ( a bit dark). Space between tables was very close! Not intimate by any means if that is important. Service was excellent, quick and efficient.
The food was delicious.We tasted the almonds and cow cheese. I had the Rigatoni and my better half had the Italian stew. The rigatoni was tasty and the sauce was complimentary along with the cheese. The beef stew was rich and tasteful too!
author: Paul G.

description: Needed a quick take out dinner while staying in fidi and read great things about this place. I ordered the gnoccho fritto (arugula, burrata, and prosciutto) and the orrechiette (pesto pasta with fennel and sausage) as an entree. The salad was good but I would prefer more arugula in it- would've balanced out the huge amount of burrata. The orrechiette had great flavor but they could've cooked the pasta a little longer. Overall, this place is perfect for quick dinners and has affordable price points!
author: Joy-Alonica B.

description:
3.5*

Ive only been here once but service is attentive almost to the point you feel little rushed.

Food:
-handcut pasta w meatballs: meatballs were juicy and seasoned nicely w herbs. Pasta had nice bite to it. Thick udon-like noodle with a chewy texture.. 4/5* went well w tomato based sauce and greens.
-gluten free pasta made w corn (?): Not so good. About half the pasta was broken. Texture of pasta grainy. Asparagus was overcooked. The prosciutto was not strong enough for the dish. 2/5*
-brussels sprouts: nice dish. Fried and greasy yes but flavorful. Strong acidity but after first bite, you'll enjoy it. Browned lightly and well seasoned.

Overall I liked the food but didn't love it. Id be back only for the first pasta dish and brussels sprouts.
author: Kimberly C.

description:
Had excellent shrimp sandwich 
service was good and friendly
sat at bar and could visit with guest.
somewhat noisy
author: Steven M.

description:
Brussels Sprouts were great, they prepare them the way i do - roasted at a super high temp so they get what my mom calls "burnedy-doos" that's a technical term referring to the crisped and slightly charred outer leaves.  They finish them with a vinaigrette which Bernies my usual drizzle of balsamic.  

The braised lamb shoulder ragu was outta this world but, honestly, the MVP of that dish was the "pasta tubes" that they served the ragu over.  That pasta was so luscious, fresh and perfectly cooked.  And those olives?  Stop!  So good. 

Their homemade classic lemonade was awesome.  Man that is fresh. 

Decor is super cute, looks like your in somebody's shwanky kitchen.  Great little intimate spot!
author: Emma H.

description: Cavatelli pasta with octopus ragu, fennel, amd crushed tomatoes (their special of the evening) and the asian pear gelato are two of my favorite things.
author: P C.

description:
Got here on a weeknight for a late dinner. The pace was still busy and people kept arriving giving it a casual but chic vibe.
We ordered the roasted octopus salad which was amazing - I wish they served this in dinner portions!  Followed this up with a rabbit pasta and a bolognaise. The rabbit pasta was bland while the bolognaise was decent. 
However, the service was what prompted me to reduce the stars. Indifferent and rather inattentive server, who needed to be reminded to bring us bread for the table. Our appetizer arrived fairly quickly, but the mains took the longest time to arrive!! Some bread + olive oil would have been nice during the wait - but no such luck! Apart from our main server, the other staff was good about refilling our drinks and such which I appreciated. 
The table next to ours despite being seated and ordering later, got their food before us making me wonder if orders were actually going in sequence! 
The olive oil ice cream was good. I liked most of the items we ate here, but the inconsistent service would prompt me to seek out other options in the future.
author: Pal P.

description:
The last time I came here was like 5 years ago, wow.  I decided to write an update because I was blown away last Friday during lunch.  We ordered the corn fusilli - and OH MY GOD - it was seriously the best tasting pasta I've had in years.  It was just THAT good.  It was crazy delicious.  It was thebombdotcom.  I have no words.  Well, I guess I do.  But yes, so good, just so good.  

And in general, I wanted to reiterate that Barbacco is just SUCH a solid, solid choice for a meal.  The food is consistently good.  The prices are reasonable. It has a modern design, yet it's still comfortable and casual.  So much going for it!

I love this sort of "modern Italian" restaurant, and I'd highly, HIGHLY recommend a trip!  But oh, make sure to make a reservation first.  This place gets busy - for good reason!
author: Vivian C.

description:
I had a great time here! I ran across a few reviews of this place and had to check it out. It is a very cozy interior but a little odd shaped tables. 
We had a relatively new server it seemed like and he seemed to be a bit lost but who I'm guessing is the woman manager was more than helpful with us and had a smile on the whole night. 
We went with the brussel sprouts, lamb shank, meatballs and order of the truffle cheese. Best Damn Cheese I ever had in my life. The meatballs were quite good and while I am a huge sprouts lover (it's my favorite food), this was a small portion and too lemony for Tony and I.
I genuinely liked this restaurant and plan on coming back to try their other dishes.
author: Kelly T.

description: Came here for dinner with a friend and had the chicken liver pate appetizer which I thought was phenomenal. I'm biased though because I love pate anything. Also had their fish of the day (swordfish) and it was amazing. The fish was well cooked, well portioned and was hearty. Ordered brussel sprouts on the side and they were good but I've had better elsewhere. Overall a solid Italian restaurant and I wouldn't mind coming back again.
author: Valerie L.

description:
I came here on a date, and we were seated at the bar. A table would have been much preferable, since it wasn't all that easy to connect, but it wasn't our first meet (or our only destination for the evening), so I guess it was okay. 

To start, we ordered the fried brussel sprouts, the fried polenta, and the grilled octopus. My favorite was probably the last. I could have had an entire plate of it by myself. The sprouts were a close second. They were flavored well and addictive. They weren't, however, pleasant while digesting and in the to-go container, haha, as the resulting odor wasn't the most attractive aroma. I liked the texture of the polenta, but I wished there was another flavor involved to complicate the palette. 

For my main, I tried peposo, and it was surprisingly spicy. Luckily I'm a fan of spicy food. The beef was tender and fell apart at the touch of my fork. The accompanying polenta was delicious, but a tad bit overkill after our appetizer (but that was my fault in ordering). 

I asked for a glass of red wine, and the server matched one with my dish. I can't remember the name of it, but it was perfect.
author: Lisa S.

description: I really liked this place.  An excellent meal.  We had drinks appetizers, dinner and dessert and it didn't break the bank.  The chicken liver and the grilled octopus appetizers were delish. I had the meatballs.  They were so moist and the sauce was just the right amount of seasoning.  I had the lemon cake for dessert and my sister had the coffee creme brulee.  We also liked the atmosphere.  I hip vibe and not too noisy.
author: Robbie M.

description: Barbacco is great for a fast and cheap Italian food. The appetizer with cured meats is the best they have and the chicken that made the news years ago is fantastic. I wish this place it wasn't that busy, sometimes I do not bother going there to avoid the long waits.
author: Janet T.

description:
Barbacco is the inexpensive sister to fancier and more upscale Perbacco.  If you arrive at 5 PM you be a bit confused as to when the restaurant opens.  A sign in front of the restaurant says 5 PM, as does YELP, but signage on the restaurant window tells you the place opens at 5:30.  The latter is correct and  you would think a restaurant would be clear about that. Really!

I was the first diner seated last night at 5:30 and was placed at the end of the counter rather than at a formal table.  And that with an Open Table reservation.  Why do that to a patron?

Immediately on being seated my server asked what I wanted.  My response was to know the specials of the day.  He didn't know and went to find out.   On being told that a seafood special of sole was available I asked the price.  He didn't know and went to find out.  After my first course the eating utensils were taken but not replaced so when my second course arrived I waited a little while for a knife and fork.  Really! 

My meal started with the spicy meatballs that come with pine nuts and raisins.  This was nice enough although it was served luke-warm.  

Next up was braised chicken thighs.  Again this was nice enough but yet again this was served luke-warm.  One almost had the feeling that these dishes had been prepared well in advance and then given a shot in the microwave.  I don't know this to be the case but certainly hope not.

The price was right for my meal at a bit over forty dollars including tax and tip.  Yet I left thinking that my meal could have been so much better with a few tweaks here and there.
author: David D.

description: Love.It. BUT, PLEASE, put the lasagna Bolognese back on the menu. It is winter now, we neeeeeed it. I get taking it off for summer, but come on, it's getting cold. Put it back on the menu!!!
author: Pearl R.

description: Had a blast here, the food was amazing and left feeling satisfied! Will def come back again!
author: Alison B.

description: Haven't reviewed in a long time, but man oh man this was bad. Cold mushrooms, sour noodles, mushy meatballs, and Fancy Feast quality pâté. Food took forever to come out. Best part was the water served by the diligent waitstaff.
author: Chen F.

description: I went here back in 2010 and it was excellent. I went here again in 2017 and it is still excellent. This place has very high standards when it comes to food and service. Truly one of the best experiences I have had.
author: Benny T.

description:
I'm a fan. Met my friend from high school--we go way back--for dinner. Made rezzies for 6 p.m., they seated us right at 6 p.m., the beer came quick, and I decided to order the catch of the day, which was ling cod.

It was perfect.

Most restaurants will overcook the fish and serve it to you chewy. The "American" way (which is usually the wrong way). For example, see Waterbar, see Sotto Mare. Always disappointing eating their cooked fish.

At Berbacco, they know what they're doing. Just past the tartare stage, perfectly moist and flaky. Seasoned subtly to perfection. 

The beets and the brussels sprouts were excellent accompaniments.

And then more beer came!

The only downside, but not enough to deduct a star, is that like most trendy FiDi/downtown/SF joints, there seems to be a requirement for diners to yell their conversations and make sure the mindless nonsense they rattle on about dominates all those around them.
author: Yowz A.

description: The food is good, but the portions are really small for the price. I would go back for a business lunch, but I don't think I'd be willing to spend my own money on these portions. The food would have to be truly astonishing to justify it, and while it is solidly very good it is not revolutionary.
author: Cynthia S.

description: Brussel sprouts appetizer was a huge hit. And both the dinner lasagna and meatball dishes were both delicious!!
author: Roxy P.

description: We went about a year and a half ago and gave 5 stars. It's nice to go back and give 5 stars again. The food is great. The service could have gone south, but the manager stepped in and really took care of us. Highly recommended.
author: Julio L.

description:
Barbacco is our office's go-to restaurant for all things catering. They are always super reliable, on-time, and friendly. Their catering orders arrive nicely packaged and our guests always rave about the food. They are also great for working lunch meetings or any last minute lunch requests. You can place a lunch order at 11 for a small group of people and it'll be ready for pickup in 30 minutes. The staff is a pleasure to work with, from the people running the takeout counter, to the delivery men who graciously unload all of the catering dishes for us. 

Our favorite dishes are: 
- Kale and roasted squash salad
- Lasagna Bolognese
- Farrotto - one of my FAVORITE dishes ever, creamy delicious farro, jam-packed with mushrooms. 
- Polpette
- Braised chicken thighs
- Focaccia - by far the BEST focaccia I've ever had outside of Italy. Super squishy and oily without being greasy. So delicious! 

I've never actually dined at Barbacco, but given that their food is incredibly delicious outside of the office, I'm sure it's an even better experience dining in!
author: Regina L.

description:
I think the food was just okay.... it didn't impress me to return. The dishes were overall very heavy and the pork loin tasted a little funky. Although they have offer several different types of salads, they seemed overpriced for what was in it... I got the citrus salad, which was just okay; nothing memorable.

I did, however, liked the seasoned almonds. They make a great snack!
author: Janet H.

description: This is the sister (and side by side) restaurant to Perbacco which my husband frequents.  He likes Perbacco but wanted to try something new so we thought we should try this for lunch.  It was a good choice as after walking all over the city for hours we were hungry.  We selected two rustic sounding and filling Italian dishes. My husband got the orecchiette and I got the farro risotto (farrotto). His dish was beautiful to look at, green with herbs, pecorino and mixed with a flavorful fennel sausage. It was as pretty as it was delicious. My dish was the perfect aldente farro with rich cheese and lots of delicious roasted mushrooms and spinach. It was creamy, chewy, slightly salty (In a good way), rich and flavorful. The menu is amazing, it took me a while to decide, and it has a more casual, rustic feel than Perbacco. It was also really crowded even at 2 for lunch. I would recommend it.
author: Melanie D.

description: Took friends in that are visiting from Hawaii.  Delightful risotto and pastas.  Lovely wine list, and though we didn't have a reservation, they worked us in very quickly.  Service was efficient and I like to take my out of town visitors to a great spot in FiDi.  Have to run.
author: Francesca S.

description:
Modern Italian restaurant with a nice ambiance.

I love their chitarra dish, hand cut pasta and Sicilian meatballs.

The Brussels sprouts fried in duck fat are also very good.

Their gelato is also outstanding.
author: David T.

description: This is just plain delicious food!  Prepared elegantly, served hot, and with flair and courtesy.  The folded pasta filled with braised rib meat was amazing!  Truly Italian food and presentation.  Highly recommended.
author: John D.

description:
Charming Italian restaurant with an intimate ambience. I came here for dinner with a few friends and we all loved it!

Pros:
-We started off with Odisea Dream Albariño, a light white wine with hints of apple. Not cloyingly sweet, but also not too peppery. A balanced addition that paired well with our pasta and proteins!
-The highlight of this meal was the bruschetta with prosciutto, burrata, and arugula. It was my first time having burrata cheese, and needless to say, I loved it! Tasted like a hybrid of mozzarella and Brie, with just the right amount of buttery richness. The prosciutto and arugula were fresh and delicious, as well
-I had the corn fusilli for my main entree. While it looked like your standard plate of Mac and cheese, the roasted butternut squash and cubed prosciutto provided just the right balance of sweet and salty. The pepper cream sauce, topped off with some parsley, also added some texture and spice
-I sampled my friend's oriecchiette and farrotto - both were delicious! Would definitely recommend all of the pasta plates
-The service was pretty quick. ~15 minutes for all four of our plates, plus our appetizer
-Very affordable, given quality and quantity of food. At first glance, a plate of pasta seems like nothing until you're halfway in... a standard dish can definitely last 1.5 to 2 meals
-Seasonal menu. It's clear that Barbacco sources fresh, local ingredients!

Cons:
-None
author: Patricia Z.

description:
We came here for lunch and was surprised that the restaurant is full on a week day. Luckily we got our seats at the window. There was no stopping us from eating here. 

We ordered their delicious pasta and were very satisfied. My lamb ragu with jumbo penne looking pasta was delicious. The red sauce is rich and intense and they were generous with their lamb and pasta. My friend got their corn fusili and it was very tasty too. 

Service here is also quite attentive. You do have to ask for water and bread since California has a huge drought and not sure why the bread...

All in all, it is a solid Italian restaurant. I would like to try other things on the menu as well.
author: Athena C.

description: If you would like to have a relax dinner it is not the correct place, with 7 oclock, the noise is increasing. But the place, decoration and menu good! I highly recommend almond cake!
author: Hatice S.

description: Came on a Saturday. Food was amazing - ambiance was a little business like - then again we were in the financial district so I suppose that comes with the territory.
author: Angela B.

description:
Tried out Barbacco for dinner on Sat 8/9/14 with no reservations right when it opened at 5:30pm.  We got the table in the back, separate bathrooms are in the back.

FREE house still or sparkling water.  We got sparkling.

Ask for Acme bread if you want some.  6 small slices w/ a small container of olive oil/balsamic vinegar.  You can get refills too.

Got the small chef selection of salumi $11.  It's got some breadsticks, 5 slices of Acme bread toasted, some pickled cauliflower, 4 different kinds of salumi w/ about 4 slices of each.  We liked them.

Kale salad $8 - it's pretty good for kale salad.  It has grapes, toasted hazelnuts, some cheese, & lots of kale.

brussel sprouts fried in duck fat $5 - we liked them because they didn't taste as bitter I thought & a bit crunchy.

B. got a Chicken under a Brick $17 - it didn't look like it was under a brick, just a small hen it looked like to me.  Some greens under it.  He liked it.

I got fettucine verde $14 - the waiter told me they took off the Lasagna, but the sauce was similar.  It was pretty tasty, good amount of homemade spinach pasta, lots of meat in the tomato sauce.

Olive oil panna cotta $6 - tasty w/ some marinated stonefruit & some brown sugar crumble on top.  We liked it.  This was comped for us.

Bill with 1 glass of wine $11 & all the dishes, tax, & Healthy SF was $74.65 before tip.  Charge it.
author: Ann L.

description:
There was nothing great about this place. We had the swordfish, the brussel sprouts, the lasagna, the tomato soup. Nothing was good. The fish wasn't fresh, the tomato soup tasted like tomato sauce, the brussel sprouts were greasy, and the lasagna lacked flavor. Typically when you go to a mediocre restaurant, there is at least one redeeming factor. Not here...

Additionally, there was urine all over the bathroom and my husband fell. Pretty disgusting...

I have been wanting to go here for a long time and it was a waste of a dinner in a city with many better options.

The service was ok and was the only positive element of the experience.
author: Tasha R.

description:
TASTY SANDWICH 

Update. Been here for dinner but not lunch, until today. Decided to try their sandwich since pasta would be too filling at this hour. Came here around 2:30pm (very late lunch, very busy day) and the restaurant was pretty empty. 

GRILLED FLANK STEAK - caramelized onions, provolone piccantes, arugula, rosemary aoili (in an Acme roll). The taste and size of the sandwich is well worth your dollar. The flank steak was cooked medium which had the perfect grilled taste with charred marks, it was a very tender piece of steak. Presentation was simple. And the dry salad of arugula, onions, and shaved cheese was a good pairing. 

My sandwich came out very late (25 minutes) and I was on a tight time bomb with little time to eat. The manager was kind to put it on the house. I really appreciate the service. After I ate my meal they asked if I would like sweets or coffee - I declined due to the sensitivity of time but it was a nice gesture. 

Will I be back? Of course. 

Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description:
I am a fan of their sister restaurant Perbacco so maybe my expectations were set a bit higher than if I've never been to Perbacco. I could definitely tell the difference in terms of food quality/recipe/attention to detail, and customer service- just not as good as Perbacco. 

Food was okay and customer service was alright. Nothing noteworthy on the dishes that I had that night and they forgot to put the Parmesan cheese on the side as I had asked so they took the dish back... and as a result, we couldn't eat our dishes together at the same time. 

Would I come back? Yes, if a friend wanted to come back. But I probably won't suggest this place, at least for dinner at its price point.
author: Iris H.

description: Got the ORECCHIETTE"little ears" / cavolo nero fennel sausage / pecorino cheese.  Really really good.  Service is fine.  $15 for pasta with $3 tip is reasonable.
author: Jill P.

description: Went here for lunch one day and was very impressed. I highly recommend getting the polenta as a side!
author: Amanda B.

description:
Great ambiance, but disappointing for its price point. The food was bland, and 5/6 of our party reached for salt/pepper to season our food. My farro risotto had very little flavor, and I definitely bit into a couple pieces of husk that should have been removed. 

The servers forgot to bring out our food after they had boxed it away. Granted we should have asked for it, but we spent a good 10-20 minutes settling our check, and at no time were our boxes brought out.
author: Sam W.

description: I like everything about this restaurant but the service. Do not waste your time to make a reservation cause it`s worthless.
author: Matt S.

description:
Solid experience. It was easy to make a reservation. The dishes I got to try are: orecchiette, carbonara rigatoni, fruit salad, bruschetta with burrata & prosciutto and lasagna. Each dish was flavorful with decent portion. 

My favorite was the bruschetta and the orecchiette. Carbonara had this weird plastic taste towards the end and my friend didn't end up finishing it. The burrata on bruschetta was very delightful as well. 

Seemed like they really push you to get drinks (they call it their specialty, we call it biggest profit margin) so maybe next time!
author: Becky M.

description:
Came here again and same bottom line - the pasta's a good deal!  I had the orecchiette with kale pesto, fennel sausage, and pecorino and the pasta had a nice chew to it and was loaded with dark leafy greens.  The overall portion size was quite large.  Only issue is it was slightly salty and I would have liked to see a little more sausage.

We also tried the tagliata flat iron steak and it was excellent.  The meat had a well seasoned crust and was medium rare and very tender, and was beautifully complemented with spicy arugula, sweet roasted sunchokes, and caramelized onions.  A great dish, just a small portion size for a "main."  But I guess that's why you also order a pasta to help fill you up!

To start, we also had the hamachi crudo appetizer.  It was fresh, light and refreshing but i probably wouldn't pay $12 for 3 slices of hamachi again.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
It was good- but I wasn't blown away by anything.
We ordered the brussels sprouts in duck fat since I love brussels sprouts and had read the raves about them. They were good but I've had better. 
For our mains, Hubs ordered the Chitarra and I had the Beef Cheeks "Peposo". Both entrees were good- I liked the spice of the Chitarra. The beef cheeks were very tender and it was a tasty, comforting dish- however, it was similar to a dish I make at home which then made it less special to me. I like to experience new flavors and tasting sensations when I am out.
Lastly, we were sitting at the bar and the artichokes looked so good- I had to sample. I really enjoyed the mint flavor- it was a combo I had not thought of- but I don't think it was worth the price. 
Overall this is a solid choice in the area.
author: Andrea K.

description:
First and foremost, I'm honestly generally not a fan of Italian food because I don't really like pasta in general, so I was pleased that they had a lot of other options. 

Their salads and veggies/sides are pretty standard. Nothing necessarily bad about them but nothing that makes them different or special. The sides are pretty much drenched in oil though, which I find to be excessive and unnecessary when it comes to veggies, so if you're grease-adverse, I'd avoid them.

Most of the pasta and entree dishes didn't really stand out to me either. The only thing I'd really, really recommend are the SICILIAN MEATBALLS (also recommended by 7x7 in their 2014 Big Eat List). I personally didn't enjoy the pastas that much because they're mostly very heavy and creamy, but some people like their pastas that way. Heaviness aside, I didn't find the pastas to be particularly interesting flavor-wise.

4 stars for the meatballs though! And their focaccia bread is pretty good.

====================

*** SALADS ***

Their salads are decent and a good alternative for a lighter, healthier meal, but nothing really special. The ingredients are generally pretty fresh. 

If you want meat, get:
    -BUTCHERS SALAD (romaine, pickled peppers, ham, salami, mozzarella, croutons)

If you want fruit, get:
    -ARUGULA SALAD (arugula, apples)
    -KALE SALAD (kale, pomegranate)
    -SEASONAL FRUIT SALAD (apples, bananas, grapes, berries) - Varies depending on what's in season, like pineapples or persimmons

If you want a heavier, more filling salad:
    -KALE AND FARRO (kale, farro, tomato, cucumber, olives, red onion) - The farro will fill you up!

My personal favorite:
    -ROASTED BEETS SALAD (arugula, beets, goat cheese) - Get if you like beets!

====================

*** SIDES ***
